body_html:
You can use tensor.random_ as so:

torch.zeros(size).long().random_(low, high)

But yes as you mentioned I think it would be nice to have some torch function be able to give random numbers. Maybe something like numpy.random.randint?
body_text:
You can use tensor.random_ as so:
torch.zeros(size).long().random_(low, high)

But yes as you mentioned I think it would be nice to have some torch function be able to give random numbers. Maybe something like numpy.random.randint?
body:
You can use [tensor.random_](http://pytorch.org/docs/0.3.1/tensors.html?highlight=random_#torch.Tensor.random_) as so:
```
torch.zeros(size).long().random_(low, high)
```

But yes as you mentioned I think it would be nice to have some `torch` function be able to give random numbers. Maybe something like `numpy.random.randint`?
